intro: Chuquiraga glabra, commonly known as the smooth chuquiraga, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are generally smooth and lance-shaped, and it is often found in high-altitude environments. Chuquiraga glabra is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine by local communities.
